meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or distance on foot.
meanings.sent1: She outfooted her friends in the race.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah easily outfooted the other animals in the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outfooted the hare in the unexpected race.
meanings.sent4: His determination to win the marathon allowed him to outfooted his competitors.
meanings.sent5: The champion runner outfooted all expectations with her incredible speed.

meanings.definition: Having a faster pace or longer stride than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The outfooted athlete quickly crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The horse with the outfooted stride won the race effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The outfooted rabbit hopped ahead of the others in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her outfooted steps echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The outfooted gazelle gracefully leaped over the grasslands.
